intro: Bocquetia pseudolanata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers, which range in color from white to deep purple, are pollinated primarily by birds and insects. Bocquetia pseudolanata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of indoor and outdoor environments.
